stimulusHtml:
• Moving from left to right:
    • The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 3 to quadrant 4 to quadrant 1.
    • In quadrant 2 the curve falls sharply to the x axis.
    • In quadrant 3, the curve falls sharply to cross the y axis at point A.
    • In quadrant 4:
      • The curve falls sharply before it levels off.
      • The curve then turns and rises sharply, passing through point B, to the x axis. 
    • In quadrant 1:
      • The curve rises sharply before it levels off at point C.
      • The curve then falls sharply, passing through point D, before it levels off at point E on the x axis.
      • The curve then rises sharply.
 
 

The figure shows the graph of a polynomial function f. Consider the five points labeled A, B, C, D, and E. These points indicate locations of intercepts and extrema for f and points of inflection of the graph of f. Which of the following statements is true?
choicesHtml: A is the location of a relative minimum, C is the location of a relative maximum, and D is a point of inflection of the graph.
E is the location of a relative minimum, C is the location of a relative maximum, and B is a point of inflection of the graph.
E is the location of a relative minimum, D is the location of a relative maximum, and B is a point of inflection of the graph.
E is the location of a relative minimum, C is the location of a relative maximum, and A is a point of inflection of the graph.
